data.text:
22 Notable alumni of

Salesian Pontifical University

Updated: February 29, 2024

EduRank

Salesian Pontifical University is 1727th in the world, 581st in Europe, and 32nd in Italy by aggregated alumni prominence. Below is the list of 22 notable alumni from Salesian Pontifical University sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.

Tarcisio Bertone

Born in

Italy

Years

1934-.. (age 90)

Occupations

diplomatuniversity teacherCatholic priest

Biography

Tarcisio Pietro Evasio Bertone is an Italian prelate of the Catholic Church and a Vatican diplomat. A cardinal since 2003, he served as Archbishop of Vercelli from 1991 to 1995, as Secretary of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith, Archbishop of Genoa from 2002 to 2006, and as Cardinal Secretary of State from 2006 to 2013. On 10 May 2008, he was named Cardinal-Bishop of Frascati.

Guido Marini

Born in

Italy

Years

1965-.. (age 59)

Occupations

Catholic priesttheologianuniversity teacherCatholic bishop

Biography

Guido Marini is an Italian prelate of the Catholic Church who serves as the bishop of Tortona in northern Italy. A priest since 1989, from 2007 to 2021 he was Master of Pontifical Liturgical Ceremonies, serving under Pope Benedict XVI and Pope Francis. Before joining the papal household, Marini worked in the Archdiocese of Genoa, where he was the personal secretary to three archbishops from 1988 to 2003, chief liturgist from 2004 to 2007, and chancellor from 2005 to 2007.

Joseph Zen

Years

1932-.. (age 92)

Occupations

Catholic bishopLatin Catholic priest

Biography

Joseph Zen Ze-kiun, SDB is a retired Chinese cardinal of the Catholic Church who served as Bishop of Hong Kong from 2002 to 2009. He was made a cardinal by Pope Benedict XVI in 2006 and has been outspoken on issues regarding human rights, political freedom, and religious liberty.

Carlos Filipe Ximenes Belo

Born in

East Timor

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

politicianCatholic priestCatholic bishop

Biography

Carlos Filipe Ximenes Belo, SDB, commonly known as Carlos Belo or Ximenes Belo is an East Timorese prelate of the Catholic Church. He became a bishop in 1988 and served as the apostolic administrator of the Diocese of Díli from 1988 to 2002. In 1996, he shared the Nobel Peace Prize with José Ramos-Horta for working "towards a just and peaceful solution to the conflict in East Timor". He is a professed member of the Salesians.

Angelo Amato

Born in

Italy

Years

1938-.. (age 86)

Occupations

university teacherCatholic priestdeanarchbishoppedagogue

Biography

Angelo Amato, S.D.B., is an Italian cardinal of the Catholic Church who served as the Prefect of the Congregation for the Causes of Saints between 2008 and 2018. He served as Secretary of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith from 2002 to 2008 and became a cardinal in 2010.

Óscar Andrés Rodríguez Maradiaga

Born in

Honduras

Years

1942-.. (age 82)

Occupations

university teacherCatholic priestCatholic bishop

Biography

Óscar Andrés Rodríguez Maradiaga, S.D.B. is a Honduran prelate of the Catholic Church who was Archbishop of Tegucigalpa from 1993 to 2023. He was president of Caritas Internationalis and served as president of the Latin American Episcopal Conference (CELAM) from 1995 to 1999.

Raúl Silva Henríquez

Born in

Chile

Years

1907-1999 (aged 92)

Occupations

Catholic priestlawyerCatholic bishop

Biography

Raúl Silva Henríquez SDB was a Chilean prelate of the Catholic Church, a cardinal from 1962. He served as Archbishop of Santiago de Chile from 1961 to 1983 and as Bishop of Valparaíso from 1959 to 1961. Both as Archbishop and in retirement, he was an advocate for social justice and democracy and a forthright vocal critic of the military dictatorship of Augusto Pinochet—"a constant thorn in the Government's side".

Ricardo Ezzati Andrello

Born in

Italy

Years

1942-.. (age 82)

Occupations

Catholic bishopCatholic priest

Biography

Ricardo Ezzati Andrello is an Italian prelate of the Catholic Church who has lived and worked in Chile since the age of 17. He was Archbishop of Santiago from December 2010 to March 2019 and has been a cardinal since February 2014. He previously served as Archbishop of Concepción. He headed the Episcopal Conference of Chile from 2010 to 2016.

Tomáš Zdechovský

Born in

Czech Republic

Years

1979-.. (age 45)

Occupations

journalistpoetwriterpolitician

Biography

Tomáš Zdechovský is a Czech politician and businessperson. Since 2014 he has been a Member of the European Parliament with KDU-ČSL, which is part of the European Peoples Party.

Péter Fülöp Kocsis

Born in

Hungary

Years

1963-.. (age 61)

Enrolled in Salesian Pontifical University

Studied in 1989

Occupations

Catholic bishopCatholic priest

Biography

Péter Fülöp Kocsis is the metropolitan archbishop of the Archeparchy of Hajdúdorog and the head of the Hungarian Greek Catholic Church.

Angelo Vincenzo Zani

Born in

Italy

Years

1950-.. (age 74)

Occupations

Catholic priesttheologianuniversity teacherphilosopher

Biography

Angelo Vincenzo Zani is an Italian prelate of the Catholic Church, who was named Archivist and Librarian of the Holy Roman Church in September 2022. He was the Secretary of the Congregation for Catholic Education, its second-highest officer, from November 2012 to September 2022 after serving as its third-highest official for ten years. He has been an archbishop since 2013.

Virgílio do Carmo da Silva

Born in

East Timor

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Enrolled in Salesian Pontifical University

Studied spirituality

Occupations

Catholic bishopCatholic priest

Biography

Virgílio do Carmo da Silva SDB is an East Timorese Roman Catholic prelate who was appointed Bishop of Dili on 30 January 2016. He became an archbishop when the diocese was elevated in 2019.

Raphaël François Minassian

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1946-.. (age 78)

Occupations

Catholic priest

Biography

Patriarch Raphaël Bedros XXI Minassian, I.C.P.B. is a Lebanese-born hierarch who serves as the 21st patriarch of the Armenian Catholic Church. He previously served as ordinary of the Ordinariate for Catholics of Armenian Rite in Eastern Europe, which covers Armenia, Georgia, Russia, and Ukraine, from 24 June 2011 to 23 September 2021 and as a Patriarchal Exarch of the Armenian Catholic Patriarchal Exarchate of Jerusalem and Amman from 26 September 2005 to 24 June 2011.

Antoni Vadell Ferrer

Born in

Spain

Years

1972-2022 (aged 50)

Occupations

Catholic bishopCatholic priest

Biography

Antoni Vadell i Ferrer was a Spanish Roman Catholic prelate.

Bernardica Juretić

Born in

Croatia

Years

1963-.. (age 61)

Occupations

politicianmonkpsychologist

Biography

Bernardica Juretić is a former Croatian Catholic nun and psychologist who served as the Minister of Social Policy and Youth in the Cabinet of Tihomir Orešković from 22 January 2016 until its dissolution and appointment of the new government in September 2016.

Luigi Bonazzi

Born in

Italy

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

Catholic priestdiplomat

Biography

Luigi Bonazzi is an Italian prelate of the Catholic Church who works in the diplomatic service of the Holy See. He has been the apostolic nuncio to Albania since December 2020. He was the apostolic nuncio to Canada from December 2013 to December 2020.

Peter C. Phan

Born in

Vietnam

Years

1943-.. (age 81)

Occupations

priest

Biography

Peter C. Phan is a Vietnamese-born American Catholic theologian and the inaugural holder of the Ellacuria Chair of Catholic Social Thought at Georgetown University.

Edmundo Valenzuela Mellid

Born in

Paraguay

Years

1944-.. (age 80)

Occupations

Catholic bishopCatholic priest

Biography

Archbishop Edmundo Ponziano Valenzuela Mellid SDB is a Roman Catholic missionary currently serving in Paraguay as the sixth Metropolitan Archbishop of the Archdiocese of Asunción. On February 13, 2006, he was appointed by Pope Benedict XVI as Apostolic Vicar to Chaco Paraguayo, an area with a population of 18,000 but only 5 ordained priests. As a result of this appointment, he was consecrated to the episcopate 22 April 2006. Prior to this appointment, Valenzuela served as a high-profile missionary in Angola. Valenzuela was ordained a priest of the Salesians of Don Bosco in 1977.

Milena Minkova

Years

20th Century

Occupations

classical philologistuniversity teachertranslator

Biography

Milena Minkova is a Bulgarian scholar of the Latin language. She has lived, studied and taught in Switzerland, Germany and Italy. She is now a resident of the United States and teaches Latin and Classics at the University of Kentucky in Lexington. Since the last decade of the 20th century, she has been one of the leading figures in the revival of the use of Latin among Latin scholars and teachers. She earned two Ph.Ds in Classics and Latin, one from the University of Sofia (1992) and the Pontifical Salesian University in Rome (1995).

Fernando Legal

Born in

Brazil

Years

1931-2023 (aged 92)

Occupations

Catholic priestCatholic bishopCatholic deacon

Biography

Fernando Legal was a Brazilian Roman Catholic prelate. He was bishop of Itapeva from 1980 to 1985, Limeira from 1985 to 1989, and São Miguel Paulista from 1989 to 2008.

Meron Mazur

Born in

Brazil

Years

1962-.. (age 62)

Occupations

Catholic priestCatholic bishopCatholic deacon

Biography

Bishop Meron Mazur, O.S.B.M. is a Brazilian Ukrainian Greek Catholic hierarch. He is currently the eparchial bishop of the Ukrainian Catholic Eparchy of Imaculada Conceição in Prudentópolis, an office that he has held since 12 May 2014. From 12 December 2005 until his assumption of his present position, he was the titular bishop of Simitthu and the auxiliary bishop of the São João Batista em Curitiba.

Jerome Dhas Varuvel

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Occupations

Catholic bishopCatholic priest

Biography

Bishop Jerome Dhas Varuvel, SDB, was born 21 October 1951 in Paduvoor in the diocese of Kottar. He attended Carmel Secondary School in Nagercoil. From 1967 to 1968 he followed the pre-university course at the Scott Christian College, Nagercoil. From 1968 to 1970 he attended the minor seminary at St. Aloysius Seminary in Nagercoil. He studied philosophy at Sacred Heart Seminary in Poonamallee. He also obtained a bachelor's degree in Economics from Arulanandar College, Karumathur, Madurai (1973-1976). In 1976 he decided to join the Salesians of Don Bosco. After completing the pre-novitiate (1976-1977) and novitiate (1977-1978), he made his religious profession temporary 24 May 1978. On 24 May 1981, he made his perpetual vows. From 1981 to 1986 he studied theology at the Salesians in Rome. He has a bachelor's degree in Economics and in Theology and a Licentiate in Pedagogy at the Pontifical Salesian University in Rome.
